summary: The diff clearly adds frontend UI affordances for re-checking on-chain status and copying/displaying a txid in the transfer details dialog, and introduces new helper utilities and admin-related diagnostics that are not part of the stated requirements. Due to backend/main.mo being truncated, the core backend requirements (broadcast-on-create, failure rollback semantics, and a confirm-on-chain backend method) cannot be conclusively verified from the provided diff summary.

hallucinated_features.description: Added URL/sessionStorage parameter utility helpers (including hash query parsing and session persistence) unrelated to Send BTC mainnet broadcast/confirmation requirements.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest does not ask for any URL parameter parsing or sessionStorage persistence functionality.

hallucinated_features.description: Admin gating/debug/diagnostic behavior added/expanded in frontend hooks and app flow (development-only traces, token detection, admin verification UX).
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest focuses on Send BTC mainnet posting and completion confirmation; it does not request admin diagnostics or token-related routing behavior changes.

BuildRequest does not request adding a migration module; it only constrains the backend to remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo (a migration file may be legitimate support work, but it is not explicitly requested).
